alert.note: Alert for Barry (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 11:18AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, McDonald and Newton. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1115 AM CDT, The Department of Transportation reported numerous flooded roadways from previous heavy rain in the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Up to an additional 0.5 inches of light to moderate rain are expected through this afternoon. - This includes the following low water crossings... Hickory Creek at Coler RD, Butler Creek at Kings Highway, Buffalo Creek at Klondike Road, North Indian Creek at Orchid Drive, Elkhorn Creek at Highway CC, Little Sugar Creek at Skaggs Hollow Road and Shoal Creek at Farm Road 2110. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Neosho, Monett, Pineville, Granby, Anderson, Noel, Goodman, Purdy, South West City, Wheaton, Lanagan, Fairview, Dodge, Newtonia, Pioneer, Stella, Stark City, Powell, Rocky Comfort, Pleasant Ridge and Big Sugar Creek State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
